item.title: Nintendo Switch 2 Game Trend May Upset Physical Game Collectors
item.description:
Summary

  • Majority of third-party Nintendo Switch 2 games revealed thus far are on Game-Key Cards, not cartridges, raising concerns for physical copy collectors.
  • Only Cyberpunk 2077 will have game data on cartridge, while other titles like Street Fighter 6 will be on Game-Key Cards.
  • Concerns are raised about physical copies not containing game data, leaving collectors with useless boxes and potential future playability issues.

Gamers who like purchasing physical copies of games may not be happy when the Nintendo Switch 2 comes out, judging by the pre-order listings of third-party games for the console. A large number of the games for the Nintendo Switch 2 that are now available for pre-order will not contain the actual game data on the cartridge.

The Nintendo Switch 2 already has supply issues, it seems, as the demand in Japan has greatly outweighed the number of consoles that will be available at launch. While it's unlikely that this development will have a significant impact on those numbers, it may nonetheless disappoint those who want to keep physical copies of games.

When the Nintendo Switch 2 Direct fully detailed the system, it was revealed that some physical copies of games would be arriving on Game-Key Cards, rather than standard Game Cards. Nintendo Switch 2 Game-Key Cards don't actually contain the files for the game, and instead only include a license access key that allows users to download the game from Nintendo's servers onto their Nintendo Switch 2. This isn't unheard of in the industry, but now, pre-order listings for new third-party Nintendo Switch 2 games have shown that nearly none of them actually contain the game, with all but one third-party Nintendo Switch 2 game shipping with Game-Key Cards thus far.

Majority of Third-Party Nintendo Switch 2 Games Aren't on Cartridge

As reported by Gematsu, early listings for third-party games on the Nintendo Switch 2 have begun appearing on Japanese retailer sites. When looking at third-party games for the Nintendo Switch 2 that aren't Nintendo Switch 2 Edition upgrades, of the dozen or so titles that have emerged with box images, only Cyberpunk 2077 seems to actually be included on its cartridge. Titles like Bravely Default: Flying Fairy , Street Fighter 6 , and Yakuza 0: Director's Cut are all shipping Game-Key Cards, which only contain the license for their games. However, it's worth noting that this has been determined by looking at the game boxes, and not all third-party games have revealed their box art, so it's not clear if the ratio will break down the same way when all third-party games are fully listed.

Nintendo Switch 2 cartridges can support up to 64 GB worth of data, so it's possible that some of the games coming to the system simply can't fit on the cartridge. However, considering that Cyberpunk 2077 was able to do so, it seems more likely that the majority of games that are releasing as Game-Key Cards could have instead shipped with the actual game data in the box.

Physical releases of games that don't actually contain the game data are becoming more common, and it's something collectors aren't happy about. Providing that one has good internet speeds, downloading a game isn't really that big a deal. However, it essentially means that a physical copy is just taking up space, since it serves no real purpose beyond accessing the game's digital files and confirming that the player has the rights to access the title. Some have also worried about the distant future, hypothesizing that someday the digital distribution platforms could be taken offline, while others have worried about the present, pointing out that some digital games can't be played without an internet connection.

While it's possible that this could change in other regions, Nintendo Switch 2 fans probably shouldn't hold their breath. In addition to securing a Nintendo Switch 2, users may want to ensure that they have good download speeds and additional storage to hold any downloaded games.

item.title: Oblivion Remastered: How To Get Armor & Weapons Of Cataclysm (Burning Trail Quest)
item.description:
Elder Scrolls 4: Oblivion Remastered offers a bunch of goodies in its deluxe edition, including two new armor and weapons sets. One of those gear sets is the demon-themed Cataclysm, which can be obtained through the Burning Trail quest that also comes in the deluxe package. Players will need to do a bit of exploration and infiltrate a cult to finally be able to use the Cataclysm armor and weapon sets. So, here's how these Oblivion Remastered deluxe edition items.

How to Start the Burning Trail Quest for Cataclysm Armor & Weapons in Oblivion Remastered

Players can start the Burning Trail quest by entering the Imperial City's Talos Plaza District in Oblivion Remastered . There are a couple of barrels present under the dragon statue, and one of the barrels has a Mythic Dawn Pamphlet attached to it.

Grab the Mythic Dawn Pamphlet 1, and you'll add the Burning Trail quest to the log. Since you've already found one, now you need to locate the other three Mythic Dawn Pamphlets before unlocking the Cataclysm armor and weapons that come in the Oblivion Remastered deluxe edition.

Collect the Other Three Mythic Dawn Pamphlets

The next pamphlet can be found at Hircine's Shrine , south of the Imperial City. There's a statue of a man and a wolf, with the clue stating to follow the wolf's gaze. There's a tree directly opposite the statue that players can look behind to find Mythic Dawn Pamphlet 2.

The third note can be found near the Horned Fiend's shrine, called Molag Bal's Shrine , located west of the Imperial City. According to the clue, players need to follow the Light of Dawn to find the next note. There's a boulder opposite the statue that players need to cross over to find a large tree. Look behind the three to grab the Mythic Dawn Pamphlet 3.

The location of the fourth Mythic Dawn Pamphlet isn't stated explicitly, as the clue states the note's location is in a decayed city where the Larsius river touches the bay. You'll need to head to Castle Bravil , located further south of the Imperial City, next to the Larsius River. After entering the castle grounds, head to the center to spot the Bravil's Lucky Old Lady statue.

Players will need to look at the base of the statue to find the Mythic Dawn Pamphlet 4, which mentions that players will need to find a Shy Dunmer, who is familiar with fire. So, you'll need to find the person in the nearest Inn.

Where to Find Shy Dunmer in Burning Trail Quest

If you're having trouble finding the Inn to locate Shy Dunmer in the Burning Trail quest in Oblivion Remastered , take a look inside Lonely Suitor Lodge . It's right across the bridge towards the right. After entering, speak to the attendant Bogrum Gro-Galash, who'll indicate that the Shy Dunmer is Ranaline.

Although Ranaline will be standing right next to the entrance of the lodge, she can be found wandering around the area at times. Speak to her, and players may have to use Speechcraft to build trust with her . Once the trust is built, she'll inform players about a gathering happening in the Mingo Cave, and players will have to don the cult robes to attend it.

Infiltrate the Cult in Mingo Cave

Reach the Mingo Cave, and if you're wearing the robes, enemies inside won't attack you. Keep heading deeper into the cave until you find Mehrunes' Harbinger . She'll ask you to light the pyre under the prisoner to complete the ritual, so players will have a choice here to either commit murder or take off the robes and attack cult members.

Whatever decision you make, Mehrunes will be impressed by your actions and will grant a special spell that will allow players to summon her at will. If players decide to attack the cult members, they'll have to fight their way out of the Mingo Cave.

Summon Mehrunes' Harbinger to Get Deluxe Edition Cataclysm Armor & Weapons in Oblivion Remastered

Once outside, equip the Summon Mehrunes' Harbinger spell and use it. Mehrunes' Harbinger will immediately arrive next to the players and ask them what kind of equipment they want. Players who want all the weapons from the Deluxe Edition can simply head into all the categories of weapons and select the "All of Them" dialog option.

However, this can make your character over-encumbered , so it's best to only get the weapons that fit your playstyle, as you can summon her to get other weapons at any time. Now you'll have the following weapons as part of the Oblivion Remastered deluxe edition Cataclysm set.

Weapons

Battle-Axe of Cataclysm

Bow of Cataclysm

Claymore of Cataclysm

Dagger of Cataclysm

Longsword of Cataclysm

Shortsword of Cataclysm

Mace of Cataclysm

War Axe of Cataclysm

War Hammer of Cataclysm

Gear

Boots of Cataclysm (Light & Heavy)

Cuirass of Cataclysm (Light & Heavy)

Gauntlets of Cataclysm (Light & Heavy)

Greaves of Cataclysm (Light & Heavy)

Helm of Cataclysm (Light & Heavy)

Shield of Cataclysm

item.title: Disney Dreamlight Valley’s Star Wars Content is a Perfect Opportunity to Address a Big Criticism
item.description:
Like any other game, Disney Dreamlight Valley has its own pitfalls. These weaknesses range from criticisms in certain areas of gameplay, to content additions, and more. But one of Disney Dreamlight Valley ’s most reasonable criticisms is unfortunately intertwined with the stigma that the simulation genre faces.

While video games can be played by anyone regardless of gender, the simulation genre has been deemed by some as “girly.” This is obviously a reductive, and sexist, way of viewing one of the most diverse video game genres, but the stigma around simulation and cozy games is very much real. Combining the simulation genre with Disney animation, which is of course known for its long run of profitable heroines and princesses, leads to a one-two-punch of “girly” content in the form of Disney Dreamlight Valley. Again, anyone can play any game as they see fit, but the fact remains that Disney Dreamlight Valley is viewed through this lens.

Disney Dreamlight Valley Is Neglecting Masculine and Gender-Neutral Clothing

In fact, Disney Dreamlight Valley itself tends to target players with a preference for femininity. The number of masculine cosmetic items, like wigs, costumes, hats, and so forth, is significantly lower in comparison to items typically catered towards women. The lack of masculine clothing shows that Disney Dreamlight Valley is surprisingly non-inclusive, leaving players with masculine styles by the wayside. Even gender-neutral pieces are uncommon in Disney Dreamlight Valley , with the game heavily relying on the Disney princess franchise when it comes to designing clothing.

This is despite the fact that Disney properties could easily inspire masculine versions of these costumes. For example, rather than simply adding items inspired by Kristoff, a masculine blue suit to contrast with Elsa’s iconic blue gown could be a great option for Disney Dreamlight Valley players that prefer masculine clothing while still giving Frozen a nod.

But Disney Dreamlight Valley may not have to rely on Walt Disney Animation and Pixar Studios for inspiration when it comes to new masculine clothing. As part of the Wonderland Whimsy update, a set of Jedi robes, a lightsaber hand accessory with an accompanying photo pose, and R2D2 himself will be available for purchase in the Premium Shop.

Star Wars Content Could be the Catalyst for More Masculine Items

It would be unsurprising to see Disney Dreamlight Valley use Star Wars as an avenue to fix the game’s lack of masculine pieces of clothing. After all, a significant number of Star Wars heroes are male, making costumes inspired by the franchise’s icons, like Luke Skywalker, Han Solo, etc., logical clothing additions if Disney Dreamlight Valley decides to travel down this route.

Star Wars is also one of Disney’s biggest moneymakers. Sure, Disney Dreamlight Valley has yet to add any characters outside of Walt Disney Animation or Pixar Studios to its roster, but content inspired by properties outside these divisions is commonplace among Disney Dreamlight Valley ’s various clothing, furniture items, motifs, and more. It makes perfect sense that Disney Dreamlight Valley has decided to capitalize on the popularity of Star Wars , especially when its addition could easily alleviate the criticism the game faces over its lack of masculine clothing.

A more inspired take from Disney Dreamlight Valley , like masculine designs inspired by female characters or even the Occam’s razor approach of making all clothing present in Disney Dreamlight Valley wearable for all regardless of an avatar’s gender, would arguably be better than simply adding a “boyish” property to the game. Nevertheless, the addition of Star Wars to Disney Dreamlight Valley will likely be popular and profitable. Hopefully, this attention will encourage Disney Dreamlight Valley to add more masculine, and gender-neutral, clothing items to the hit simulation game.

item.description: Exploration can make or break an open-world game. It’s about what that world makes players feel: curiosity, intrigue, awe, dread.

item.title: Oblivion Remastered Duplication Glitch Guide
item.description:
Most of the classic exploits have been patched out of The Elder Scrolls 4: Oblivion Remastered , but players have already discovered a new duplication glitch that allows them to create huge piles of lockpicks, arrows, and valuables in the blink of an eye. The Oblivion Remastered duplication glitch works on both PC and consoles, and it's incredibly easy to perform on both keyboard and controller.

Players are always going to seek out duplication glitches whenever they start playing a new RPG, but the remastered version of Oblivion removes most of the glitches that players have grown accustomed to over the years. Oblivion Remastered is still Oblivion at its core, though, so it was only a matter of time before another duplication exploit was discovered. This Oblivion Remastered duplication glitch is perfect for stocking up on things like arrows and healing potions, and it also works on valuables like jewelry to make a ton of gold.

How to Do the Oblivion Remastered Duplication Glitch

The Oblivion Remastered duplication glitch requires an empty container like a chest, but any container will do. The Imperial City Market District has a bunch of crates and sacks that work perfectly for this. Once a suitable container is found, open it and press the F key or R3 on a controller to select " search " and open the inventory menu.

At this point, both the container and the player's inventory should be visible side by side . Place the items that you want to duplicate into the container by itself . Next, look in your inventory for a large stack of items like arrows. That's how many duplicates will be created of the targeted item. Then, highlight your own inventory on the left side of the screen so that the arrow at the top of the screen is pointing toward the container .

Now it's time for the duplication process. On PC , drag and drop the large stack of items from your inventory onto the target item in the container. A menu will pop up asking "how many." Press the Enter key twice to confirm. If done correctly, the duplicated items will be in the player's inventory.

To do this on PlayStation or Xbox with a controller, press R1/RB and X/A at the same time while hovering over the stack of items in their inventory. Then, confirm twice when the "how many" prompt appears.

The Oblivion Remastered duplication glitch will most likely get patched out in a future update, so players should take advantage of this exploit while they still can. It's currently one of the best ways to make money in Oblivion Remastered , so it's a perfect way to save up for a house.
